programme.desc: The Eagles and Giants end their 2025 series. Cam Skattebo scored three TDs as New York doubled up Philadelphia 34-17 on Oct. 9. A.J. Brown and DeVonta Smith (PHI) combined for over 300 yards receiving and three scores in a Week 7 win over Minnesota.

programme.title: Live: NFL Football
programme.desc: Denver hosts Dallas. Teams down 18 points with six minutes to play in the fourth quarter lost 1,602 consecutive games prior to the Broncos' 33-32 triumph over the Giants in Week 7. Denver set a franchise record with 33 points in that fourth quarter.

programme.title: Live: Football Night in America
programme.desc: "Football Night in America" features host Maria Taylor, Hall of Fame head coach Tony Dungy, former NFL head coach and quarterback Jason Garrett, former NFL quarterback Chris Simms and NFL insider Mike Florio recapping the day's NFL highlights. Co-host Jac Collinsworth and two-time Super Bowl champion Rodney Harrison contribute on-site each week.

programme.title: Live: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Lionel Messi and Inter Miami FC welcome Nashville SC to South Florida for Game 1 of a best-of-three first-round series in the MLS Cup playoffs. Messi ended the regular season in style with three goals and an assist in Inter Miami's 5-2 win at NSC.

programme.title: CFL Football
programme.desc: The Tiger-Cats (10-7) go for the East Division title when they host the Redblacks (4-13). Hamilton seeks its first East crown since 2019, and its fifth season sweep of Ottawa in six campaigns after taking both ends of a home-and-home set in July.

programme.title: CFL Football
programme.desc: The Elks (7-10) complete their campaign with a Battle of Alberta clash against the Stampeders (10-7). Edmonton, out of the playoffs for the fifth straight season, has won five of the last six contests against Calgary after splitting two 2025 matches.

programme.title: Live: College GameDay
programme.desc: Originating from the site of one of the day's best matchups, with a sea of fans cheering wildly in the background, host Rece Davis and analysts Lee Corso, Kirk Herbstreit and Desmond Howard talk college football for three hours, reporting on the top teams, games, players and storylines. David Pollack and Maria Taylor contribute reports, interviews and features. Davis replaced longtime host Chris F

programme.title: Live: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 8 Rebels seek a bounce-back performance against the No. 13 Sooners. Ole Miss comes off a 43-35 setback to then-No. 9 Georgia on Oct. 18. Oklahoma put its Red River Rivalry loss in the rearview by beating South Carolina, 26-7 that same day.

programme.title: Live: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 4 Crimson Tide bring a full head of steam into this match with the Gamecocks. Alabama has won six in a row, with the past four victories coming over ranked opponents after a 37-20 verdict against then-No. 11 Tennessee on Oct. 18.

programme.title: Live: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: Live: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 3 Aggies (7-0, 4-0 SEC) seek their first 8-0 start since 1992 when they visit the No. 20 Tigers (5-2, 2-2). The home team has won the last eight engagements. Texas A&M quarterback Marcel Reed has accounted for 19 touchdowns, 15 passing.

programme.title: CFL Football
programme.desc: The Alouettes (10-7) visit the Blue Bombers (9-8) in Manitoba. Winnipeg doubled Montreal 26-13 on the road earlier this year. Brady Oliveira totaled 210 yards from scrimmage and scored for Winnipeg in that win. The Als are 6-2 away from home in 2025.

programme.title: CFL Football
programme.desc: The Roughriders (12-5) and Lions (10-7) tune up for the playoffs in a potential West final preview. West Division champ Saskatchewan has won four straight meetings. A.J. Ouellette (SSK) rushed for 367 yards and three touchdowns during those contests.
